intro: Solenanthus stamineus, commonly known as the stamen solenanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its botanical features include showy, tubular florets that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Solenanthus stamineus is often found in rocky or coastal habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
